summary:
Sociaal stedenbouwkundige gespecialiseerd in de kwaliteit van de leefomgeving en in het bijzonder de openbare ruimte. 
Met jarenlange werkervaring opgebouwd in het ruimtelijke en sociaal-ruimtelijke domein in diverse context en in verschillende landen, draag ik bij aan het verbeteren van de leefomgeving met bijzondere aandacht voor kwetsbare wijken. Ik verbind het harde van de fysieke stad aan het zachte van het menselijke gebruik.
Mijn kennis verbreed en verdiep ik graag ten gunste van projecten en ik ben secuur in mijn aanpak en aannames. Ik leg makkelijk contact en hou van werken in een omgeving met verschillende stakeholders uit verschillende sectoren. 

Werkveld: openbare ruimte (inrichting, ontwerp, gebruik), gezonde leefomgeving, leefbare buurten, wijkaanpak, stadssociologie, bewonersbetrokkenheid

-------------------------------------
Urbanist with experience in a wide variety of complex projects in several countries. Passion for intercultural working environments and humanity. I have a broad interest in society. In order to gain new insights and come to effective approaches, I am particularly open to cooperation with other sectors.

Specialized in: Development and implementation of inclusive approaches in the fields of Urban Development, Public Space Development, Public Space Design, Social Urbanism, Urban Sociology and Community Development.

school.name: University of Amsterdam / Universiteit van Amsterdam

projects.title: Ruta de la Experiencia - Project Leader
projects.description:
The Ruta de la Experiencia is one of the largest UN selected Village projects for the Habitat III conference in Quito, Ecuador. As a project leader, I am responsible for the development and execution of the Ruta de la Experiencia project. This practical project shows the principles and methodology of the Human Cities Coalition. The physical interventions in the Ruta - such as greening, lighting and painting – and the social interventions visualize HCC’s approach to create sustainable improvement of cities’ liveability for all. The ‘Fabrica Ciudad’, lodged in the Centro Cultural Benjamin Carrión, is part of HCC’s Ruta de la Experiencia and it assembles local city makers and inhabitants to create and share ideas on inclusive urban development in Quito. HCC is demand-driven, strengthens existing citizens’ initiatives and unites relevant parties from private sector, government and civil society to cooperate on tangible solutions.
Partners in the Ruta: AkzoNobel, Arcadis, Philips Lighting, Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Pakhuis de Zwijger, IHS, KLM, Alliander, KPMG, Dutch Embassy of Peru/Ecuador and Bolivia. With thanks to inhabitants and local businesses of La Mariscal, Van Vlier Media, Interquimec Ecuador, EPMMOP, Pontificia Universidad Católica del Ecuador, Municipality of the Metropolitan District of Quito, Habitat III Secretariat.

contributors.headline: Urbanist at Urbanos and Regional designer at Provincie Noord-Holland
Urban manager for a sustainable future

projects.title: Human Cities Coalition - core set-up team
projects.description:
Starting up the Human Cities Coalition. The HCC consulting team is commissioned by AkzoNobel to set up a Human Cities Coalition. 
The Human Cities Coalition aims to stimulate a positive contribution to the Post-2015 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), of which nr 11 explicitly concentrates on inclusive and sustainable urban development.
The Human Cities Coalition deploys a public-private partnership approach to encourage sustainable and inclusive urban development for citizens in fast growing urban areas in Africa, Asia and Latin America, including the 40% most poor. The tripartite approach involves as of day one all three parties: civil society, business and government.
The HCC developed it's unique approach scoping in two cities: Mumbai (India) and Accra (Ghana). Currently HCC is in the process of preparing two other pilot projects.

contributors.headline: Social Entrepreneur | Develops and Accompanies Projects for Inclusive Urban Area Development in Mega Cities | Profitability for All Stakeholders
Community&Stakeholder Engagement expert| Social Performance| Community audits & assessments & participation

projects.title: Speaker at Unicef/IDS Conference "Rethinking Urbanisation and Equity in Asia"
projects.description: Giving a presentation about the Importance of Public Space in Informal Settlements at the IDS-Unicef (ROSA) conference held in Sussex, UK, 9-10 June 2014.

projects.title: Researcher spatial characteristics in urbanizing contexts in developing countries
projects.description:
Research about the spatial character and the use of public space in rapidly urbanizing, highly mobile informal settlements in the developing world. The research provides insight into how the city works at the intersection of social and spatial use. 
This research emphasizes and explains the social importance of public space and the effects of social and spatial characteristics on the well-being of children in informal settlements. It focuses on the importance and implications of public space throughout different interrelated scale levels: from household to government and from courtyard to neighborhood. 
The aim of the research is to contribute to the development of innovative programming focused on highly mobile urban settlements under rapidly urbanizing conditions.

projects.title: Participating WUF7  in Medellin, Colombia
projects.description:
Attending the WUF7 in Medellin, Colombia. The World Urban Forum (WUF) is a non-legislative technical forum convened by the United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat), to examine the most pressing issues facing the world today in the area of human settlements, including rapid urbanization and its impact on cities, communities, economies, climate change and policies. It is the World’s Premier Conference on Cities. 
Theme WUF7: Urban Equity in Development; Cities for Life.
Amount of visitors: 15.000-20.000

projects.title: Consulting and Design Redevelopment Sommeldijckse Kreek, Suriname
projects.description: This was an assignment of the governmental ministry of Public Works of Suriname, in cooperation with WorldWaternet. Due to repeating water level problems leading to sanitary problems and socially unsafe areas along the Sommeldijckse Kreek the assignment was to develop a vision on these socio-spatial problems with a translation into a design and general development guidelines. Involvement: socio-spatial analysis, spatial analysis and design advice.

projects.title: Consulting and Design in Decentralisation Project Stoelmanseiland, Suriname
projects.description: This was an assignment of the Foundation for the development of the interior regions of Suriname (Foundation FOB), a semi- governmental organization that resorts under the Ministry of Regional Development. This organization focuses on the stimulation of the socio-economic development of the interior resident populations, to enable them to build durable rural economics. Stoelmanseiland is a show case project for other decentralized villages throughout the interior of Suriname. A development strategy is made for upgrading Stoelmanseiland from an isolated, very small border settlement to a regional base with primary facilities for the regional inhabitants. The project incorporates water and sanitation specialists, an anthropologist, and local authorities and inhabitants. Involvement: socio-spatial analysis, spatial analysis, design strategy and advice for short term and long term development, workshops with local inhabitants, workshops with stakeholders.

projects.title: Consulting and Urban Design Housing Project Richelieu, Suriname
projects.description: This was an assignment of the governmental ministry of social affairs and public housing. In order to create residential space the design was developed as an example project for an attractive self-sustaining ‘satellite-village’ of Paramaribo in which social housing is mixed with private housing including an area for the development of a centre-functions. Area 350 ha, 4000 parcels. Involvement: Urban planning 1:10,000 to public space design 1:10 for the city grid streets and waterways in phase 1 (1200 dwellings), presentations and workshops for stakeholders, training of staff in spatial design issues.

projects.title: Public Space Design Amsterdam Rai Congress Area / Europaplein
projects.description: The development of a new metroline connecting the historic city centre of Amsterdam to the international business heart of Amsterdam (Zuidas) gave a new impulse to the Rai area along the route, which connects the most popular neighbourhood of the Netherlands (Amsterdam Zuid of the famous architect Berlage) to the Zuidas international business centre (which is currently under construction). Under very high design standards the new city square Europaplein was developed, with modern translations of famous Amsterdam School elements and integrated art of an internationally known artist. Involvement: design studies to final design.

projects.title: Public Space Kop Zuidas
projects.description: The east side of the Zuidas is being transformed to a very dense mixed urban area with business, education, food service industry, religious buildings, theatre, residential/living along a waterpark. Involvement: design 1:1000 total area, several design studies and sketch designs of key-parts of the area like waterpark landscape.

projects.title: Public Space Zuidas West
projects.description: The southwest side of the Zuidas is home to a major university and hospital. In addition to these functions the area is being intensified with living, business and related functions. Involvement: design studies total area, final designs “ten-year-proof representative temporary streets” (in order to regulate the complexity in logistics).

projects.title: Teacher / Lecturer Anton de Kom University, Suriname
projects.description: Teacher in the creation of the design part of the urban course for 3rd year students and a post-graduate programme (two programs of one week fulltime).  Several lectures about urban planning and spatial problems concerning changing car use, population density and the importance of green for a healthy city. Expert supervision in graduate project from urban design and architecture candidate.

projects.title: Urban Design Re-development Valparaiso, Chile
projects.description: The design for re-developement of a former harbor and infrastructure hub in the city center of Valparaiso, Chile.

projects.title: Urban Planner and Writer of the Ruimtelijke Ontwikkelingsstrategie Woningbouw Groot Paramaribo (Spatial Strategy Paramaribo-area), Suriname
projects.description: This was an assignment directly from the GOB Suriname (development agency started by the government) and the governmental ministry of social affairs and public housing. An integrated spatial strategy for the development of the whole Paramaribo region that is to be used by diverse governmental departments to streamline a diversity of processes related to the growth of Paramaribo. The product is a very practical, integrated vision with spatial analysis of the area leading to practical recommendations and guidelines for all acting stakeholders. Product is presented to and handed over to the government of Suriname. Involvement: generating the strategy, workshops with local stakeholders, spatial analysis.

profile_positions.description:
Als projectleider ben ik actief op het gebied van leefbaarheid, gezonde groene leefomgeving en brede wijkaanpak. Mijn kernexpertise ligt op openbare ruimte en (diversiteit van) bewoners. Ik werk op het snijvlak van de grote fysieke en sociale vraagstukken van vandaag en zoek in netwerk en kennisuitbreiding de verbinding tussen het ruimtelijke en sociale domein.
Verbonden aan o.a. projecten Herstructurering 2.0, Maatschappelijke Voorzieningen, het Nationaal Programma Leefbaarheid en Veiligheid, WijkWijzer, Mooi Nederland.
profile_positions.title: Senior projectleider at Platform31

profile_positions.description:
Locus 33 levert diensten op het gebied van inclusieve stedelijke ontwikkeling, waarbinnen de ontwikkeling van sociaal-ruimtelijke concepten ten behoeve van versterking van woonbuurten en kwetsbare groepen. De ambitie van Locus 33 is om de leefkwaliteit in (super)diverse buurten te versterken.
Locus 33 werkt samen met relevante partijen die aan de buurt verbonden zijn, waaronder gemeentelijke overheid, onderwijs, jeugd- en welzijnswerk, private partijen.
profile_positions.title: Urbanist @ Locus 33

profile_positions.description:
Long looked forward to a year around the world with our teenage sons. The corona crisis changed all original plans, pushing our flexibility and adaptability to the limit throughout the year.
And yet this was the most fantastic and unforgettable experience.
profile_positions.title: Sabbatical - Traveling

profile_positions.description:
LIFTcities strives for making cities social, functional and safe places for all. 
LIFTcities is a convening organisation, assembling parties to work jointly on inclusive urban development, focusing on vulnerable areas with low income groups. LIFT cities mobilises and combines needed local knowledge and technical expertise. It concentrates on rapidly urbanising areas in large and medium sized cities. 
The holistic approach contributes to upgrading vulnerable areas (e.g. slums) and include them in the total city structure. It addresses slum exclusion and contributes to breaking the vicious circle of poverty in slums.  
LIFTcities staff has professional expertise in the fields of urban planning and design, economics, development of communities and organisations and has many years of relevant field-experience with civil society, government and NGO’s.

Key words LIFTcities: urbanisation, socio-economic inclusion, urban development, cross-disciplinary, multi-scale level.
profile_positions.title: LIFTcities - Urban Specialist
